page.title: 18NEWLAND HALL,ROXWELL
page.content: Newland Hall belonged to King Harold. The house, which is very large, stands by the left of the road which leads from Boyton Cross into Margaret-Roding about a mile from Roxwell Church. Newland Hall was built early in the 16th century. It was owned, in 1519, by Margaret Gedge but half of it was owned by Thomasine Gedge. On January 16th 1538 George Gifford had licence to transfer one moiety to another man called Richard Hales and later in 15th January 1540 to transfer a moiety to Thomas Arnndell. But the estate still remained in the Gedge family because James Gedge had 3 daughters named Mary then 14, Joanne 13 and another Joanne aged 10. In 1748 William Taylor was the owner of Newland Hall and he was later named William Taylor Howe.
